categories.content: Frameworks and UI libraries for building user interfaces in the browser.

subcategories.content:
• Vue.js: A progressive JavaScript framework for building dynamic user interfaces.
  • Angular: A comprehensive framework for building large-scale web applications with a focus on TypeScript.
  • Svelte: A compiler for writing reactive and efficient user interfaces with minimal boilerplate.
  • Aurelia: A modern, open-source framework for building modular and scalable applications.
  • Cycle.js: A functional and reactive framework inspired by functional reactive programming (FRP).
  • Dojo Toolkit: A comprehensive JavaScript toolkit for enterprise-level web development.
  • Dojo: A progressive framework for building modern web applications with a focus on performance.
  • Flight.js: A lightweight framework for adding modular and event-driven components to HTML.
  • GWT: A toolkit for developing complex browser-based applications in Java.
  • Qwik: A high-performance framework for building fast and scalable web applications.
  • Ext JS: A framework for building data-intensive web and mobile applications with rich UI components.
  • Stimulus: A minimal JavaScript framework for augmenting HTML with predictable, unobtrusive behavior.
  • Webix: A UI framework for building cross-platform applications with over 80 ready-to-use UI components.

• React: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces, maintained by Meta (Facebook).
  • Alpine: A lightweight library for composing JavaScript behavior directly in your HTML templates.
  • Dropzone: A drag-and-drop file upload library with customizable drop zones.
  • Glimmer: A fast and lightweight UI component library optimized for rendering complex data-driven applications.
  • htmx: A library for building dynamic HTML-based web applications with minimal JavaScript.
  • jQuery Mobile: A touch-friendly framework for building responsive mobile web applications.
  • jQuery: A foundational JavaScript library for simplifying DOM manipulation and AJAX requests.
  • Knockout: A library for creating dynamic and responsive user interfaces with a clean MVVM architecture.
  • Stencil JS: A compiler for building reusable and high-performance Web Components.

categories.content: Frameworks for building server-side applications and APIs.

subcategories.content:
• Express.js: A minimal and flexible Node.js framework for building web and API applications.
  • Hono: A lightweight framework optimized for edge runtime environments and serverless functions.
  • Koa: A next-generation web framework for Node.js.
  • NestJS: A progressive Node.js framework for building efficient, reliable and scalable server-side applications.
  • Fastify: Fast and low overhead web framework, for Node.js.
  • Adonis: AdonisJS is a TypeScript-first web framework for building web apps and API servers.
  • Hapi: Build powerful, scalable applications, with minimal overhead and full out-of-the-box functionality.

categories.content: Tools for building, bundling, and optimizing JavaScript and TypeScript projects.

subcategories.content:
• Vite: A fast development server and build tool for modern JavaScript/TypeScript projects.
  • esbuild: An extremely fast JavaScript bundler and minifier written in Go.
  • Parcel: A zero-configuration build tool for the modern web.
  • Webpack: A powerful module bundler for managing complex JavaScript applications.
  • Rollup: A modular bundler for JavaScript with a focus on tree-shaking and ES module support.
  • Snowpack: The faster frontend build tool.
  • Speedy Web Compiler: SWC is an extensible Rust-based platform for the next generation of fast developer tools.

categories.content: Frameworks for building mobile applications using JavaScript and TypeScript.

subcategories.content:
• React Native: A framework for building native mobile apps using React and JavaScript.
  • Capacitor.js: A cross-platform runtime for building native apps with web technologies.
  • Cordova: A hybrid mobile app development framework powered by Apache.

categories.content: Frameworks that support both frontend and backend development.

subcategories.content:
• Next.js: A React framework for server-side rendering and static site generation.
  • Gatsby: A static site generator optimized for performance and SEO.
  • Fresh: A Deno-based framework for building fast and secure web applications.
  • Derby: A full-stack MVC framework for real-time collaborative applications.
  • T3: A full-stack TypeScript framework for building production-ready Next.js applications.
  • SvelteKit: A framework for building fast and modern web applications using Svelte.

categories.content: Languages that compile to or extend JavaScript.

subcategories.content:
• ClojureScript: A compiler that translates Clojure code to JavaScript for browser or Node.js environments.
  • CoffeeScript: A concise and expressive language that compiles to JavaScript.
  • PureScript: A strongly typed functional programming language that compiles to JavaScript.
  • ReScript: A statically typed language that compiles to idiomatic and efficient JavaScript.
  • WebAssembly: A low-level binary format for executing high-performance code in web browsers.

• Axios: A promise-based HTTP client for making asynchronous requests in browsers and Node.js.
  • Chart.js: A simple and flexible library for creating responsive and animated charts.
  • D3.js: A powerful library for creating dynamic and interactive data visualizations.
  • Effector: A state management library focused on functional reactive programming (FRP).
  • Greensock: A high-performance animation library for creating smooth and complex animations.
  • Highcharts: A feature-rich library for creating interactive and customizable charts.
  • p5.js: A JavaScript library for creative coding and visual arts.
  • Ramda: A functional programming library providing utility functions for immutable data manipulation.
  • stdlib: A comprehensive standard library for numerical and scientific computing in JavaScript.
  • Stylis: A fast CSS preprocessor with support for nesting, variables, and custom functions.
  • Three.js: A cross-browser library for creating 3D graphics in the browser using WebGL.
  • UnJS: A collection of utilities and libraries for building modern web applications.
  • Knockout: A library for creating dynamic and responsive user interfaces with a clean MVVM architecture.
  • jQuery: A foundational JavaScript library for simplifying DOM manipulation and AJAX requests.
  • jQuery Mobile: A touch-friendly framework for building responsive mobile web applications.
  • Stencil JS: A compiler for building reusable and high-performance Web Components.
  • Lexical: A framework for building rich text editors with a focus on extensibility and performance.
  • Leaflet: A lightweight library for creating interactive maps with markers, popups, and tile layers.
  • OpenLayers: A high-performance library for rendering vector and raster maps with advanced features.
  • jsDelivr: A free CDN for open source projects.

• Immer: A library for producing immutable updates to state using "mutating" syntax.
  • Immutable.js: A library for working with immutable collections and data structures in JavaScript.
  • Microcosm: A state management library for creating composable and predictable application states.
  • MobX: A simple and scalable state management library with reactive data binding.
  • Redux: A predictable state container for JavaScript applications with a time-travel debugger.
  • Fluxxor: Tools for implementing the Flux architecture in JavaScript applications.
  • Zustand: A small, fast and scalable bearbones state-management solution using simplified flux principles.
  • Recoil: A state management library for React applications.
• Knex.js: A SQL query builder that supports multiple databases and transactions.

• Leaflet: A lightweight library for creating interactive maps with markers, popups, and tile layers.
  • OpenLayers: A high-performance library for rendering vector and raster maps with advanced features.
• Lexical: A framework for building rich text editors with a focus on extensibility and performance.

• Cypress: With Cypress, you can easily create tests for your modern web applications, debug them visually, and automatically run them in your continuous integration builds.
  • Jest: Jest is a delightful JavaScript Testing Framework with a focus on simplicity.
  • Mocha: Mocha is a feature-rich JavaScript test framework running on Node.js and in the browser, making asynchronous testing simple and fun.
  • Playwright: Playwright Test was created specifically to accommodate the needs of end-to-end testing.
  • Vitest: ViteTest is a fast and lightweight testing framework designed to work seamlessly with Vite projects.

categories.content: Libraries for blockchain and decentralized application development.

subcategories.content: • Ethers.js: A comprehensive library for interacting with Ethereum blockchain and smart contracts.

categories.content: Object-Relational Mapping libraries for JavaScript and TypeScript.

subcategories.content:
• Drizzle: A TypeScript-first ORM designed for writing database queries in a SQL-like syntax.
  • Prisma: A modern ORM for Node.js and TypeScript that simplifies database access and management.
  • TypeORM: TypeORM is an ORM that can run in NodeJS, Browser, Cordova, PhoneGap, Ionic, React Native, NativeScript, Expo, and Electron platforms and can be used with TypeScript and JavaScript (ES2021).
  • Sequelize: Sequelize is a modern TypeScript and Node.js ORM for Oracle, Postgres, MySQL, MariaDB, SQLite and SQL Server, and more.

categories.content: Tools for documentation, type checking, package management, formatting, linting, API gateway, and module loading in JavaScript and TypeScript projects.

subcategories.content: • ESDoc: A documentation generator that produces JSDoc-style documentation for JavaScript projects.
• Flow: A static type checker that helps catch type errors in large JavaScript codebases.

• npm: The default package manager for Node.js with a vast ecosystem of open-source packages.
  • Yarn: Yarn is a package manager that doubles down as project manager.
  • pnpm: A fast, disk space-efficient package manager that uses symlinks to save space.

• Prettier: A code formatter that enforces consistent style across all files in a project.
  • ESLint: A tool for identifying and reporting on problematic patterns in JavaScript code.
  • Stylelint: A mighty CSS linter that helps you avoid errors and enforce conventions.
• Kong: A cloud-native API gateway for managing and securing microservices.
• RequireJS: A module loader that simplifies the management of JavaScript dependencies.

categories.content: JavaScript engines and runtimes for executing JavaScript code.

subcategories.content:
• SpiderMonkey: The first JavaScript engine, developed by Mozilla for Firefox and other applications.
  • V8 Engine: A high-performance open-source JavaScript and WebAssembly engine used in Chrome and Node.js.
  • JavaScript Core: Apple's JavaScript engine for Safari and other macOS/iOS applications.

• Node.js: A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine for server-side and command-line applications.
  • Bun: A fast and modern JavaScript runtime with built-in bundling and type-checking tools.
  • Deno: A secure and modern runtime for JavaScript and TypeScript with first-class module support.
